title: [BUG] catch22.ipynb notebooks throws  'Catch22' object has no attribute '_transform_single_feature'
body:
**Describe the bug**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
-->

When running the `examples/catch22.ipynb` with `jupyter nbconvert --to notebook --inplace --execute --ExecutePreprocessor.timeout=600 examples/catch22.ipynb` the following error pops up:

```
nbclient.exceptions.CellExecutionError: An error occurred while executing the following cell:
------------------
transformed_feature_uv = c22_uv._transform_single_feature(IPD_X_train, "CO_f1ecac")
print(transformed_feature_uv)
------------------

---------------------------------------------------------------------------
AttributeError                            Traceback (most recent call last)
/tmp/ipykernel_2209/4126608039.py in <module>
----> 1 transformed_feature_uv = c22_uv._transform_single_feature(IPD_X_train, "CO_f1ecac")
      2 print(transformed_feature_uv)

AttributeError: 'Catch22' object has no attribute '_transform_single_feature'
AttributeError: 'Catch22' object has no attribute '_transform_single_feature'
```


**To Reproduce**
<!--
Add a Minimal, Complete, and Verifiable example (for more details, see e.g. https://stackoverflow.com/help/mcve

If the code is too long, feel free to put it in a public gist and link it in the issue: https://gist.github.com
-->

This is taken form CI, which means ubuntu-20.04 and python 3.7.

**Expected behavior**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.
-->

Notebook executes without errors.

**Additional context**
<!--
Add any other context about the problem here.
-->

**Versions**
<details>

<!--
Please run the following code snippet and paste the output here:
 
from sktime import show_versions; show_versions()
-->

</details>

<!-- Thanks for contributing! -->
